data.title: Pierce Brosnan and Darling Keely celebrated 20 Years Married
data.meta_description: “Happy anniversary my darling Keely, my love forever grows with you…☘️❤&#xfe...
data.text:
“Happy anniversary my darling Keely, my love forever grows with you…☘️❤️ ”

The James Bond actor met American journalist/model Keely Shaye in 1994. They were married on August 6th 2001, at Ballintubber Abbey in Mayo in Ireland and have two children Dylan and Paris.

He has always expressed glowingly how caring and understanding Keely was to him, especially following the death of his first wife Cassandra Harris. She had passed away from cancer in 1991.

He said before “Keely has always been kind and compassionate and encouraged me to mourn Cassie,"

The County Louth native Brosnan paid the romantic tribute to his wife Keely on their 20th wedding anniversary, saying “Happy anniversary my darling Keely, my love forever grows with you."

Pierce recently said that he still "fancies the pants" off his 57-year-old wife.

They reside primarily in Malibu, California, with a second American home in Hawaii and Irish residences in Dublin and County Meath.

Posting the Shamrock ☘️ - showed his ever connection with Ireland.

In 2002, Brosnan was also awarded an honorary degree from the Dublin Institute of Technology and, a year later, the University College Cork.

In 2003, The 007 star was made an honorary Officer of the Order of the British Empire for his "outstanding contribution to the British film industry". As an Irish citizen at the time, he was ineligible to receive the full OBE honour, which is awarded only to Commonwealth citizens only, but he is still allowed the letters "OBE" after his name.

Pierce Brosnan became an American citizen in 2004, while retaining his Irish citizenship. He said, "My Irishness is in everything I do. It's the spirit of who I am, as a man, an actor, a father. It's where I come from."
